info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 4 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
At 359 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Sybille Canyon to Harriman Heights. Movement was east at 50 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 60 mph and half inch hail. Hail will accumulate on area roadways, including Interstate 80.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Cooler temperatures and hail will result in hail accumulation on roadways and slick conditions.
Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Burns, Happy Valley, Chugwater, Federal, Table Mountain Ranches, Willadsen Estates, Rocking Star Ranch, Silver Sage Estates, Granite Canon, Fox Farm-College, Cheyenne Regional Airport, Winchester Hills, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, North Cheyenne, Horse Creek, Curt Gowdy State Park, and Bison Crossing.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 64. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 338 and 386.
info.instruction:
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN ALBANY...LARAMIE AND SOUTHERN PLATTE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Central Laramie County; East Laramie County
